snippet: Despite Republican claims of widespread violations, it seems that credible allegations of illegal voting were exceedingly rare....
abstract: State officials across United States report they have found very few credible allegations of voter fraud in 2016 presidential election, with no state reporting indications of widespread fraud; findings clearly refute Pres-elect Donald Trump's claims that millions of illegal voters backed Hillary Clinton; experts say threat of voter fraud has proven to be minuscule problem but potent political weapon.
lead_paragraph: Despite Republican claims of widespread violations, it seems that credible allegations of illegal voting were exceedingly rare.

headline.main: All This Talk of Voter Fraud? Across U.S., Officials Found Next to None
headline.print_headline: Fraud at Polls Was Minuscule, Despite Claims
